remarks: The (right vector space) scalar product of a functional with zero is the zero functional.  Note that the first occurrence of ` ( V X. { .0. } ) ` represents the zero scalar, and the second is the zero functional. (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2014.)

lfl0sc.d $e |- D = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
lfl0sc.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
lfl0sc.k $e |- K = ( Base ` D ) $.
lfl0sc.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` D ) $.
lfl0sc.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` D ) $.
lfl0sc.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LMod ) $.
lfl0sc.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
lfl0sc $p |- ( ph -> ( G oF .x. ( V X. { .0. } ) ) = ( V X. { .0. } ) ) $.
